author: bichlienta
title: Cambodia honours officers, officials in search for Vietnamese fallen soldiers
text: The honorees made important and positive contributions from 2013 to 2020 to coordinating the search, recovery, repatriation and reburial of remains of Vietnamese volunteer soldiers and experts who sacrificed in Cambodiaâ€™s capital and 25 provinces during the war. Speaking at the event, Vietnamese Ambassador to Cambodia Nguyen Huy Tang expressed his wish for further support from the Cambodian leaders, local authorities and army for the effort until there is no longer information available about martyrsâ€™ burial locations. He also affirmed the policy of encouraging citizens from both countries to come forward with any details they might have concerning the remains and graves of fallen Vietnamese soldiers. Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Royal Cambodian Armed Forces and Commander of the Royal Cambodian Army Gen. Mao Sophan stressed that after helping to liberate the Cambodian people from the genocide regime on January 7, 1979, the Vietnamese Party, Government and people continued assisting Cambodia in overcoming the severe consequences left by the Pol Pot regime, as well as in the process of national recovery and reconstruction. Since 2001, task forces from both sides have collaborated in searching, recovering, repatriating and burying the remains of 20,852 fallen soldiers. However, the search has continued, with over 4,000 sets of remains still unaccounted for./. /

author: @indianexpress
title: Schools closed in some Tamil Nadu districts due to heavy rainfall; check list here
text:
Schools closed in some Tamil Nadu districts due to heavy rainfall; check list here Schools closed: Following the cloudburst, districts like Chennai, Ramanathapuram, Dindigul, Pudukottai, Tiruvarur, Kanchipuram, Cuddalore, and Tanjore closed schools on December 12. By: Education Desk New Delhi | Updated: December 13, 2024 11:53 IST 2 min read The Thoothukudi district administration has issued a flood warning in the Srivaikuntam and Eral areas due to heavy inflows into the Thamirabarani river. (Image: AI generated) Schools Closed: The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy rainfall in certain districts of Tamil Nadu, owing to which the district collectors of Villupuram, Tirunelveli (Nellai), Thoothukudi, and Tenkasi closed the schools today (December 13).
Following the cloudburst, districts like Chennai, Ramanathapuram, Dindigul, Pudukottai, Tiruvarur, Kanchipuram, Cuddalore, and Tanjore closed schools on December 12.
The Thoothukudi district administration has issued a flood warning in the Srivaikuntam and Eral areas due to heavy inflows into the Thamirabarani river. People in low-lying areas have been advised to move to safe places.
Advertisement In Chennai, the Public Works Department (PWD) has issued the first flood warning for the areas near the Redhills and Chembarambakkam reservoirs, the cityâ€™s chief sources of drinking water. The warning follows the dangerous increase in water levels due to incessant rain in the catchment areas.
Due to a heavy downpour upstream of Thamirabarani, a flood warning was issued to all villages and towns situated on the banks of the river, the administration said.
The revenue officials have been instructed to evacuate the people from all vulnerable places in Srivaikundam and Eral. Police and Fire and rescue services personnel have asked people to shift to safer areas.
(with inputs from PTI)

author: Tristan Justice
title: Watchdog Demands IG Investigation Into Top Fauci Deputy
text: A government watchdog sent a letter to the inspector general of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) this week demanding the agency investigate alleged evasions of transparency laws by a top advisor for Anthony Fauci. On Wednesday, the non-profit group Protect the Publicâ€™s Trust (PPT) demanded the HHS inspector general open a probe into Dr. David Morens, a senior advisor at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). In May, a [memo](https://oversight.house.gov/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/SSCP-Staff-Memo_Morens-5.22.pdf) the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Pandemic released suggested Morens inappropriately deleted records and colluded with agency officials to escape requests made under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) law. â€œI learned from our foia lady here how to make emails disappear after i am foiaâ€™d,â€ Morens wrote in one email, and referenced a â€œâ€˜secretâ€™ back channelâ€ to communicate with Fauci in another. â€œDr. Morens took it upon himself to reach out to NIH/NIAIDâ€™s FOIA contacts and apparently devised methods for effectively shielding his communications from disclosure under FOIA,â€ wrote PPT Director Michael Chamberlain in a [letter](https://protectpublicstrust.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/PPT-NIH-FOIA-IG-Complaint.pdf) to the HHS inspector general. â€œIf that were not enough, it appears as though Dr. Morens sought to rope others into this scheme, establishing a â€˜secret back channelâ€™ through which he and his colleagues could communicate for the explicit purpose of making their communications fall outside the scope of what is traditionally subject to disclosure under FOIA.â€ When he testified on Capitol Hill last month, Morens [laughed off ](https://nypost.com/2024/05/22/us-news/explosive-emails-show-top-nih-adviser-deleted-records-used-secret-back-channels-to-help-fauci-ecohealth-evade-covid-transparency/)lawmakersâ€™ questions related to the allegations of ethical misconduct. â€œI was not aware that anything I deleted like emails was a federal record,â€ said Morens. Chamberlain said the emails released by House investigators leave the HHS inspector general â€œno choice but to investigate.â€ â€œThe conduct described clearly violates the standards expected of public servants and is possibly illegal under FOIA,â€ Chamberlain said in a [statement](https://protectpublicstrust.org/press-releases/watchdog-documents-testimony-call-for-investigation-of-whether-fauci-co-broke-law-by-operating-in-secret/). â€œThe grim stakes of the pandemic make learning why they needed such secrecy a matter of life and death.â€ Fauci, who ran the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) from 1984 to 2022, distanced himself from the debacle involving Morens when he testified before the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Pandemic on Monday. â€œI do not do government business on my private email,â€ Fauci [said](https://nypost.com/2024/06/03/us-news/fauci-testifies-on-covid-19-origins-us-response-live-updates-fact-check-analysis/), denying the existence of a â€œback channelâ€ to speak with government colleagues. Lawmakers also [pressed](https://thefederalist.com/2024/06/05/faucis-testimony-reveals-the-inconsistencies-and-deceit-behind-u-s-covid-response/) Fauci about his demands for social lockdowns and repeated dismissals of alternative theories to explain the outbreak, such as a lab accident. â€œDo you agree that there was a push to downplay the lab leak theory?â€ asked Rep. Jim Jordan, R-Ohio. â€œNot on my part,â€ Fauci said. Documents released by House investigators last year, however, show Fauci and his colleagues at the NIH were [eager to suppress ](https://www.heritage.org/public-health/commentary/how-fauci-and-nih-leaders-worked-discredit-covid-19-lab-leak-theory)the lab leak theory as a â€œconspiracy.â€ Rep. Richard McCormick, R-Ga., confronted Fauci with the bureaucratâ€™s own words taped in an audiobook in which Fauci explained how governments, schools, and corporations could make their lives â€œdifficultâ€ for people who chose different medical treatments for Covid than untested injections. â€œOnce people feel empowered and protected legally, you are going to have schools, universities and colleges are going to say, â€˜You want to come to this college buddy, youâ€™re going to get vaccinated, lady, youâ€™re going to get vaccinated,'â€ Fauci said in the recorded interview played at Mondayâ€™s hearing. â€œBig corporations like Amazon and Facebook, and all those others, are going to say â€˜You want to work for us, get vaccinated,â€™ and itâ€™s proven that when you make it difficult for people in their lives, they lose their ideological bullshit and they get vaccinated.â€ â€œYou affected peopleâ€™s ability to work, travel, be educated, to actually flourish in America, to self-determine, as well as God-given rights,â€ McCormick told Fauci. â€œYou inspired and created fear through mask mandates, school closures, vaccine mandates that have destroyed the American peopleâ€™s trust in our public health institutions. This fear you created will continue to have ripple effects over generations to come.â€

author: Paul Twardock
title: Challenge Alaska | Outdoor Explorer - Alaska Public Media
text:
Challenge Alaska works with Alaskans with disabilities giving them access to adaptive sports, education, and a supportive community. (Challenge Alaska) People with disabilities live and thrive in Alaska and Anchorage. Challenge Alaska is a nonprofit that is a key organization making that happen. Challenge works with Alaskans with disabilities, giving them access to adaptive sports, education and a supportive community. Known for its adaptive ski and snowboard program in Girdwood Challenge also offers a variety of programs in Anchorage for a wide range of people, including veterans. Challenge was established in 1980 by Doug Keil, a Para-Olympic medalist in para-alpine skiing. The organization has grown to include the Raven Program for people with intellectual disabilities, the Warrior Program for Veterans with disabilities, the Para-Sport program for people with physical
and visual disabilities and the Adaptive Ski and Ride School in Girdwood.
HOST: Paul Twardock
GUESTS:
Jeff Dick , recreation therapist
Quinzee Elsberg , volunteer
JP Wood , board member
LINKS:
Challenge Alaska website
Facebook
Instagram
BROADCAST: Thursday, March 14th, 2024. 10:00 am â€“ 11:00 a.m. AKT
REPEAT BROADCAST: Thursday, March 14th, 2024. 8:00 â€“ 9:00 p.m. AKT
Paul Twardock Paul Twardock is a Professor of Outdoor Studies at Alaska Pacific University, where he has worked since 1988. He is the author of Kayaking and Camping in Prince William Sound and help found the Alaska Sea Kayaking Symposium/Paddle Sport Fun Day. At APU he teaches a variety of undergraduate classes included Sea Kayaking, Recreation Program Design, Nordic Skiing, The Business of Recreation, and Wildland Ecosystems and Human Impacts. Paul received his BS in Outdoor Recreation from Western Illinois University, went to work instructing for NOLS in Alaska, then received his MBA from APU. Paulâ€™s research includes monitoring of campsites in Prince William Sound and Chugach State Park for human impact, trail use in Chugach State Park, and the Alaska Recreational Boating Safety Incident Database. His passions include sea kayaking, river boating of all sorts, hiking, mountain running, climbing, skiing of any kind, and birding. One of his last adventures involved a mule ride.
Paul is one of several hosts for Outdoor Explorer
